intro: Pinalia fusca, commonly known as the blackleaf pincushion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically reddish-brown to black in color, giving it its common name. Pinalia fusca is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
